intro: Centropogon vittariifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and are pollinated by insects. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter.
